edu.rit.numeric

Class Histogram

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.numeric.Histogram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Histogram
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, Streamable
    Class Histogram is the base class for a histogram that categorizes values into bins and counts the number of occurrences in each bin. Subclasses of class Histogram categorize items of various types.

    Class Histogram supports doing a chi-square test on the bin counts. See the chisqr(), pvalue(), and expectedCount() methods.

      • accumulate

        public void accumulate(int x)
        Accumulate the given value of type int into this histogram.

        The base class implementation of the accumulate() method increments bin number x. A subclass may override this method to increment some other bin number.

        Parameters:
        x - Value.
        See Also:
        increment(int)

      • accumulate

        public void accumulate(long x)
        Accumulate the given value of type long into this histogram.

        The base class implementation of the accumulate() method throws an UnsupportedOperationException. If long values are to be accumulated, a subclass must override this method to increment the proper bin number.

        Parameters:
        x - Value.
        See Also:
        increment(int)

      • accumulate

        public <T> void accumulate(T x)

        Type Parameters:

        Returns:

      • prob

        public double prob(int i)
        Returns the observed probability of incrementing the count in the given bin of this histogram. This method returns count(i)/total().
        Parameters:
        i - Bin number.
        Returns:
        Observed probability for bin i.

      • total

        public long total()
        Returns the total count in all bins of this histogram.
        Returns:
        Total count.

      • expectedCount

        public double expectedCount(int i)
        Determine the expected count in the given bin for a chi-square test. This method returns expectedProb(i)*total().
        Parameters:
        i - Bin number.
        Returns:
        Expected count in bin i.

      • expectedProb

        public double expectedProb(int i)
        Determine the expected probability of incrementing the given bin for a chi-square test.

        The base class implementation of this method assumes that the bin counts are supposed to be all the same; thus, the expected probability for each bin is the reciprocal of the number of bins. A subclass can override this method to return different expected probabilities.

        Parameters:
        i - Bin number.
        Returns:
        Expected probability for bin i.

      • chisqr

        public double chisqr()
        Returns the chi-square statistic for this histogram. The expected count in bin i is determined by calling the expectedCount(i) method.
        Returns:
        Chi-square statistic.

      • pvalue

        public double pvalue(double chisqr)
        Returns the p-value of the given chi-square statistic for this histogram. The chi-square statistic is assumed to obey the chi-square distribution with B−1 degrees of freedom, where B is the number of bins.
        Parameters:
        chisqr - Chi-square statistic.
        Returns:
        P-value of chisqr.

      • logBayesFactor

        public double logBayesFactor()
        Returns the log Bayes factor for a Bayesian model selection for this histogram. Hypothesis H1 is that the observed bin counts obey the expected distribution, where the expected count in bin i is determined by calling the expectedCount(i) method. Hypothesis H2 is that the observed bin counts do not obey the expected distribution. Assuming the prior odds ratio of the hypotheses is 1, a log Bayes factor > 0 indicates that the bin counts support H1 more than H2, and a log Bayes factor < 0 indicates the opposite.
        Returns:
        Log Bayes factor.

      • add

        public void add(Histogram hist)
        Add the given histogram to this histogram. The count in each bin of hist is added to the count in the corresponding bin of this histogram. The histograms must have the same number of bins.
        Parameters:
        hist - Histogram to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if hist does not have the same number of bins as this histogram.

      • increment

        protected void increment(int i)
        Increment the given bin in this histogram. The subclass of class Histogram determines the manner in which values are categorized into bins.
        Parameters:
        i - Bin number.
